title: Quiz 2: Vit A, Deworming & School Health
description: Test your understanding of Vitamin A supplementation schedules, deworming importance, and School Health Program concepts.

questions.question: What is the recommended dose of Vitamin A for a lactating mother within the first six weeks post-partum?
questions.explanation: Lactating mothers receive a single dose of 200,000 IU at delivery or within 6 weeks post-partum.
questions.hint: It is the same dose given to children over 1 year.

questions.question: Deworming is recommended for children above the age of ___BLANK___ and should be done at least once every ___BLANK___ months.
questions.explanation: Kids above the age of 2 can be dewormed, and it is recommended at least once every six months.
questions.hint: Check the FAQ section on deworming.

questions.question: Which of the following are common symptoms of intestinal worms?
questions.explanation: Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, gas/bloating, fatigue, weight loss (not gain), and blood in stool.
questions.hint: Worms compete for nutrients, causing weakness and digestive issues.

questions.question: Match the school health term with its definition:

pairs.right: State of being diseased/unhealthy in a population
Number of deaths in a population

questions.question: Analyze the text below. Why are schools considered ideal settings for health programs?

richContent.content:
• Efficient channel to reach many people
  • Interventions in variety of ways
  • Learners at early developmental stages

options.text: Because lifelong behaviors, values, and skills are being formed
Because treatment is cheaper in schools

questions.explanation: Schools capture learners at early stages when lifelong behaviors are formed, making interventions highly effective.

questions.question: Arrange the levels of School Health Governance Structure from Highest to Lowest:
questions.explanation: The hierarchy flows from National -> County -> Sub-County -> School level.
questions.hint: Follow the administrative levels of government.

questions.question: A 'Health Promoting School' is simply a school that has a first aid kit and a nurse.
questions.explanation: A Health Promoting School is defined as one that is constantly strengthening its capacity to be a healthy setting for living, learning, and working.
questions.hint: It implies active improvement, not just static facilities.

questions.question: What is the term for a school environment that embraces safety, inclusivity, equity, and health for learners?
questions.explanation: A Child/youth friendly environment embraces safety, inclusivity, equity, and health.

questions.question: Which of the following are strategies to promote good nutrition in schools?
questions.explanation: Strategies include optimizing services, healthy food environments, education, and community involvement.
questions.hint: Community and education are key aspects.

questions.question: According to the Vitamin A schedule, at what age does a child receive their first dose of 100,000 IU?
questions.explanation: The schedule indicates 100,000 IU is given at 6 months. Subsequent doses are 200,000 IU starting at 12 months.
questions.hint: It happens halfway through the first year.
